metadata.name: Suspicious Download from Office Domain
metadata.comment: Detects suspicious ways to download files from Microsoft domains that are used to store attachments in Emails or OneNote documents

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\curl.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\wget.exe'))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('invoke-webrequest')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('iwr ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('curl ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('wget ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('start-bitstransfer')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.downloadfile(')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.downloadstring('))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('https://attachment.outlook.live.net/owa/')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('https://onenoteonlinesync.onenote.com/onenoteonlinesync/'))))

output.summary: Detects suspicious ways to download files from Microsoft domains that are used to store attachments in Emails or OneNote documents

metadata.objective: False positive: Scripts or tools that download attachments from these domains (OneNote, Outlook 365) References: https://twitter.com/an0n_r0/status/1474698356635193346?s=12, https://twitter.com/mrd0x/status/1475085452784844803?s=12
